page.title: 15Scarthingmoor Mill
page.content: This mill has been in the same family for generations and the present owner has run the farm for 39 years to date.It takes its name from an old {water mill}which was originally used to supply power for grinding grain. The{water source}was a stream behind the mill, partially dammed to divert the stream in the right direction. Although the dam is still there the wheel is no longer in use and the mill machinery is powered by{electricity. The present mill has three storeys with a central winch, for hoisting the bags of grain. The walls get progressively thinner with height. The mill now grinds wheat, barley and rye. There is a collection of old mill stones once used in the mill and replaced when they became too worn to be fully effective.
